resource.name: Legacy Baton Rouge Crime Incidents
resource.description:
***On January 1, 2021, the Baton Rouge Police Department switched to a new reporting system. This dataset contains data starting on 1/1/2011 through 12/31/2020. For data from 1/1/2021 onward, please visit: https://data.brla.gov/Public-Safety/Baton-Rouge-Crime-Incidents/pbin-pcm7

Crimes reported in Baton Rouge and handled by the Baton Rouge Police Department. Crimes include Burglaries (Vehicle, Residential and Non-residential), Robberies (Individual and Business), Theft, Narcotics, Vice Crimes, Assault, Nuisance, Battery, Firearm, Homicides, Criminal Damage to Property, Sexual Assaults and Juvenile.   In order to protect the privacy of sexual assault victims and juvenile victims, these incidents are not geocoded and will not be mapped. 

Please see the disclaimer in the Attachments section of the About page.
columns_description: Street address number where the crime occurred
Louisiana Revised Statues (LRS) code of the crime incident
Crime type general category
Date of when the crime occurred
Full crime street address for geocoding
Indicates if the crime was attempted or committed
The concatenated Baton Rouge Police Department District, Zone and Subzone
Street prefix direction of the road where the crime occurred
Baton Rouge Police Department report number
Street name of the road where the crime occurred
State in which the crime occurred
Baton Rouge Police Department Subzone number within a Zone where the crime occurred
Baton Rouge Police Department Zone within a District where the crime occurred
US Postal Service ZIP Code derived from GIS data
City in which the crime incident occured
Formatted full street address of where the crime incident occurred
Description of the crime incident
Time of day (in 24 hours) when the crime occurred
Metropolitan Council District derived from GIS data
Name of the voter approved crime prevention district if the crime occurred within the boundaries - derived from GIS data
Baton Rouge Police Department District number where the crime occurred
Street suffix type of the road where the crime occurred

resource.name: Adjudicated Property
resource.description: In the event that your taxes are not paid by a certain date, the Sheriff's Office will advertise your property for sale to the general public to collect the unpaid taxes.  On the advertised date, the property will be subjected to a tax sale.  If no one buys the property at the tax sale, the property will then be adjudicated to the Parish of East Baton Rouge in compliance with the laws of the State of Louisiana.  The records in this dataset reflect the most current adjudicated property listing.
resource.attribution: East Baton Rouge Parish Assessor's Office
columns_description:
Block or square number of the tax parcel
Name of the subdivision
The physical or situs address of the tax parcel
Mailing city, state, and ZIP code of the taxpayer
Council district in which the tax parcel is located
Fair market value of the tax parcel
The unique property number assigned to each tax parcel
Indicates the year of the Tax Roll
Ward and section number of the tax parcel
Location of the tax parcel derived from the centerpoint latitude and longitude coordinates
Mailing address of the taxpayer
Name of the taxpayer
Lot number of the tax parcel
ZIP code in which the tax parcel is located
A percentage of the fair market value determined by the use of the property (commercial or residential)
Full legal description of the tax parcel

resource.name: Legacy City-Parish Employee Annual Salaries
resource.description:
***THIS DATASET IS NO LONGER UPDATED***
In November 2018, the City-Parish switched to a new payroll system. This dataset contains annual salaries through 2017.  For data from 2018 onward, visit https://data.brla.gov/Government/City-Parish-Employee-Annual-Salaries/g9vh-zeiw

City-Parish employees' annual salaries and other payroll related information.  Information is calculated after the last payroll is run for the year specified.
resource.attribution: City of Baton Rouge - Human Resources
columns_description: Annual salary plus longevity and other earning allowances (Educational, Hazardous Pay, etc)

Status in payroll system: 
0 - Active, 
1 - Temporary Leave (no arrears), 
2 - Temporary Leave with Arrears, 
3 - Inactive, 
4 - Terminated Last Pay Period, 
5 - No longer with City-Parish.
Scheduled hours per pay period
Hourly rate based on pay grade and step
Hourly rate plus longevity and other earning allowances (Educational, Hazardous Pay, etc)
Base pay plus overtime plus/minus any adjustments
Total number of overtime hours worked for the year
Hourly rate plus allowable overtime earning types multiplied by 1.5
Most current date employee hired (Does not include broken service with the City-Parish)
End of service date.  The employee may have retired, resigned or was terminated.
Percentage of pay earned by employee for longevity with City-Parish
Total overtime amount earned for the year
Employee Number
Department Number
Division Number

resource.name: EBRP Tax Roll
resource.description: This dataset is a full listing of tax parcels in East Baton Rouge Parish including the cities of Baton Rouge, Baker, Central and Zachary.  The records contained herein include information about taxpayers, homestead exemptions, adjudications, property details, and many other topics.  The Assessor's Office provides this information for public use in an effort to better serve the taxpayers and property owners of East Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana.
resource.attribution: East Baton Rouge Parish Assessor's Office
columns_description: Tax parcel with no structure attached
The transaction type of the last conveyance
The conveyance instrument number or deed number associated with the last transaction of the parcel.
Full description of the tax parcel which serves as the legal record
Determination whether the tax parcel qualifies to receive a homestead exemption
Ward number of the tax parcel
A percentage of the fair market value determined by the use of the property (commercial or residential)
The taxable amount for determining Parish taxes derived from the sum of land/acreage value and any improvement value minus any applicable homestead exemption
The unique property number assigned to each tax parcel for the tax rolls prior to 2017.
Determination whether the tax parcel has a property tax reduction for the renovation of existing structures from a qualifying historic or economic development district

The type of assessment used to determine taxes including personal property, real property, or public service.  Personal property includes machinery and equipment, fixtures, furniture, and other items that are movable in nature and utilized in a business.  Real property includes land and all buildings, structures, improvement to the land, and mobile homes.  Public service are government and other tax-exempted properties.
Mailing subaddress of the taxpayer
Name of the subdivision in which the tax parcel is located
Block or square number in which the tax parcel is located
Indicates if a tax freeze is applied to this record

Taxing status of the parcel including actual, adjudicated, exempt or restoration abatement (RS).  Actual property is real estate that can be taxed and all tax payments are up to date.  Property with unpaid taxes is adjudicated to the Parish of East Baton Rouge in accordance with the laws of the State of Louisiana.  Public service type property is exempted from taxation. Restoration abatement property is exempt from any new building renovations, but taxes are still owed for the original value.
Name of the taxpayer
Lot number of the tax parcel
The physical or situs address of the tax parcel
Type of use of the structure including commercial, residential or not determined
The type of unit on the tax parcel which may include a structure, lot, or acreage
Date of last conveyance
The price at which the property would change hands between a willing buyer and a willing seller
A homeowner is entitled to one homestead exemption which is a maximum of $7,500 of the assessed value
Indicates the year of the Tax Roll
The unique property number assigned to each tax parcel. Also referred to as the Assessment Number.
Mailing address of the taxpayer
Mailing city, state and ZIP code of the taxpayer
Total number of structures attached to the tax parcel

resource.name: Property Information
resource.description: This dataset is a combination of attribute information from the master address table and the lot or property records table. The address points are created within a building footprint and in the case where there is no building, then the point is the center of the lot.  The address information comes from a variety of sources including final subdivision plats, building permits, E-911 master street address guide (MSAG) database, Polk City Directory, and field data collection.

resource.name: City Court Warrants
resource.description:
Listing of active warrants for Baton Rouge City Court.

Warrants are posted to the site daily, however it may take up to 7-10 days for information processed in court to be reflected on the site.  If you have questions please contact the Criminal Traffic Division via email at traffic@brgov.com or call (225) 389-5278.

This lookup is not confirmation of an active warrant.  All City Court warrants should be confirmed by the official court file.  Please contact the City Constable's Office at 389-3889 or 389-3004 for confirmation.
columns_description: Defendant's last known city of residence.
Date of Action.  Date the warrant was issued.
Defendant's last known state of residence
Defendant's year of birth
Court File/Docket Number
Judicial division of case warrant was issued on
Defendant's Sex
Type of Case for which warrant is issued:  CMISD = Criminal Misdemeanor, DV = Domestic Violence, CCTRAF = Traffic Offense, PP = Partial Payment Account, CCDWI = Driving While Intoxicated
Defendant's Race:  A = Asian, B = Black, H = Hispanic, M = Middle Easterner (Arabic), N = Native American, O = Other (Mixed), P = Pacific Islander / Eskimo, U = Unknown, W = White
Defendant's last known zipcode of residence
Name of person warrant issued for

resource.name: 311 Citizen Requests for Service
resource.description:
This dataset includes all requests for service received from the City-Parish 311 Call Center, including requests for service submitted online and through the Red Stick 311 mobile application, dating back to January 1, 2016. Submitter names, phone numbers, and e-mail addresses are redacted for privacy purposes. Data is updated daily from the Public Works Business Office and 311 Call Center.

Phone numbers are redacted to protect the contact information and privacy of citizens by replacing raw digits with XXX-XXX-XXXX. For any questions about this process, please contact opendata@brgov.com.
columns_description: Status of service request 0 = Open, 1 = Closed, 3 = In Progress.
The parent type of service request - matches that of the ParentID field.

The date of the most recent adjustment or notation to this service request, as noted by the responding department/division. Typically, this field will match that of the closed date if a request has been resolved or closed.
The name of the street where services are needed or issues need to be resolved.

The city of the reported issue - Baton Rouge, Baker, Zachary, or Central. Issues reported in the unincorporated areas of East Baton Rouge Parish or without city information are reported as East Baton Rouge.
Unique identifier assigned to each citizen request for service for tracking and resolution purposes.
Any cross street information available as reported by the submitting citizen (for example, at an intersection).
The ID of the City-Parish department and division responsible for responding to the requested service or reported issue.
The City-Parish department and division responsible for responding to the requested service or reported issue - matches that of the DeptDivID field.
The date the service request was closed due to the request  as being addressed or the issue  being resolved, confirmed by the responding department/division.
Any comments submitted by the reporting citizen associated with the request for service or issue to be resolved.
The longitude coordinates of the issue or request for service for geocoding purposes.
The date the service request was created within the City-Parish's 311 service request and complaint tracking system, either by phone, online, or via web app.
The full street address where service are needed or issues need to be resolved.
The specific type of service request represented by the request ID.
The latitude coordinates of the issue or request for service for geocoding purposes.
The street number of the address where services are needed or issues need to be resolved.
The City-Parish division responsible for responding to the requested service or reported issue, which is a division of the department noted in the Department field.
A description of the type of service request represented by the request ID - matches that of the TypeID field.
The parent category ID of the type of service request (typename) as organized within the City-Parish 311 Citizen Request system.
The City-Parish department with oversight over the requested service or reported issue.
Matches Status ID - Open, Closed, or In Progress.
